Clear selected Parameters

Basic laptops can handle Internet browsing, office applications, movie playback, or video calls. They are a good choice for those looking for a low cost notebook for basic tasks. Basic laptop batteries typically last for 4 hours or more. What to look for when choosing?

Continue

Display size

  • Under 14 " - ideal for travelling and frequent transport it is the ideal choice for students.
  • 14 "to 15.6" - suitable for travelling and for both home and work use.
  • 15.6 "and more - Laptops with this screen size are suitable for home use and are a good replacement for a PC.

Processor

When choosing a basic laptop processor, think about what activities you will be most focused on.

For low-cost users

They are suitable for basic tasks - working with office applications, watching movies or surfing the Internet.

  • Processor examples: Intel Atom, Intel Celeron, Intel Pentium, AMD E1 and E2.

Processors for more demanding users

They can handle the more difficult tasks - working with graphics, videos, or playing simpler games.

  • Processor examples: Intel Core i3 and i5 or AMD A4 and A6.

i

Are you purchasing a laptop for a long period of time? We recommend that you pay for a more powerful processor - at least the Intel Core i3, it won't be so fast but its performance will last well into the future.

Grafics card

Integrated

Intel HD Graphics integrated graphics can handle Full HD video playback and are especially suitable for less demanding activities - the Internet, office applications, viewing photos, videos and watching movies.

Dedicated

Dedicated graphics cards are designed for more demanding users who want to work with graphics on the laptop or play casual games.

  • The NVIDIA GPUs are divided into two lines - the less powerful GeForce GT and the powerful GTX on games.
  • The AMD Radeon GPUs are labelled R2 to R9 - the higher the series, the more powerful the card.

Operation memory

The more RAMs the more tasks the laptop can handle simultaneously.

  • 4 GB - minimum for surfing the Internet and working with office applications.
  • 8 GB or more - Brisk work with many open browser windows and applications.

i

Basic laptops with DDR3 memory are cheaper and fully sufficient for normal use. More expensive models have DDR4 RAM, which is faster, but more expensive.

Storage

When selecting the base notebook storage, both the disk capacity and the type of drive are important.

  • eMCC flash - The cheapest type of storage, usually has low capacity, slower speed and can not be replaced by larger.
  • HDD - High disk capacity at a favorable price. The disk is more susceptible to shocks and mechanical damage.
  • SDD - Extremely fast disk without moving particles. Compared to the HDD, it usually offers less capacity and is more expensive.
  • HDD and SSD - there are two hard drives in the notebook - HDD for bulky data, SSD for fast operation of the operating system.
  • SSHD - The combination of a regular HDD is typically a 8GB SSD cache for speeding up the notebook.

i

eMCC flash memory and solid state drives are shock-resistant. However, the SSD offers significantly higher capacity and speed than eMCC. In addition, it can be replaced for a larger capacity drive, while the eMCC flash memory is integrated on the motherboard of the notebook.

Additional equipment for basic notebooks

  • Illuminated keypad - it will be convenient to work long into the night.
  • Numeric keypad - better to enter numeric data.
  • TrackPoint - Allows you to move the cursor without having to lift your hands from the keyboard.
  • Optical Drive - for reading and burning CDs and DVDs.

Do you have any ambiguity or want to know more? We have prepared a guide for you how to choose a notebook .

Memory selection always depends on the motherboard, meaning the used chipset and what it supports. The most common type of memory is DDR3, but more modern motherboards now support the new DDR4 modules. What is the main difference between memory? The DDR3 has a maximum of 8 GB of RAM and operates at a maximum of 2133Mhz, while DDR4 can handle up to 16GB of RAM and operates at a maximum of 3200Mhz.

Basic Home and Office Laptops

Not interested in playing the latest games? Do you just want an affordable laptop that’s good enough for everyday home and office use? Then you’re at the right place! This section provides suitable models also for students.

The Best Price-Performance Ratio

You don’t have to spend a lot of money to get the performance you need for ordinary computer tasks. What’s more, thanks to energy-saving components, this section offers laptops with a great battery life. For convenience, we offer a wide range of laptop accessories such as bags, cases and backpacks for the best portability, and many more. We recommend high quality brands such as Lenovo or ASUS, who are well-known for high standard laptops for basic home and office use.
